001_e_day1_welcome.name: 001 E Day 1 - Welcome
001_e_day1_welcome.subject: Your wedding story starts here, {{contact.first_name}}
001_e_day1_welcome.previewText: A personal note from Lisa at Cameron Estate Inn
001_e_day1_welcome.content:
Hi {{contact.first_name}}, I'm Lisa, and I wanted to be the first to welcome you to Cameron Estate. I know you're probably reaching out to a few venues right now (I remember what wedding planning felt like!), so I'll keep this short and sweet. Cameron Estate isn't just a venue — it's a 225-year-old historic inn where your entire wedding weekend unfolds in one beautiful place. Your ceremony, your reception, your closest family and friends staying overnight... all here, surrounded by mature trees, gardens, and the kind of peace that's hard to find these days. What couples tell us they love most? Not having to coordinate transportation between venues, not worrying about where guests will stay, and having one experienced team handle everything from your first tour to your last dance. Two Ceremony Spaces The Spring Garden — outdoor beneath mature trees, overlooking our reflection pond. The Conservatory — elegant indoor with crystal chandeliers and a marble fireplace. Reception Venues Spring View Ballroom — intimate and refined for 50-150 guests. The Carriage House — dramatic and spacious for 150-250 guests. One Simple, Transparent Price Our per-person pricing includes everything — no hidden fees, no surprises: Ceremony space • Reception venue • Plated dinner catering Full premium open bar • All rentals (tables, linens, china, glassware) Day-of coordination team • Guest accommodations on-site No separate venue rental fee. Just one clear number. I'd love to show you around in person. There's something about standing in the garden at golden hour, or seeing the ballroom lit by candlelight, that helps you picture your own wedding day unfolding here. Ready for a tour? Just reply to this email with a few dates and times that work for you.

Weekday or weekend, whatever fits your schedule. I'll bring the warm cookies and refreshments. You bring your questions and your vision. Talk soon,
Lisa
001_e_day1_welcome.compiledHtml:
A personal note from Lisa at Cameron Estate Inn
Hi {{contact.first_name}},
I'm Lisa, and I wanted to be the first to welcome you to Cameron Estate. I know you're probably reaching out to a few venues right now (I remember what wedding planning felt like!), so I'll keep this short and sweet.
Cameron Estate isn't just a venue — it's a 225-year-old historic inn where your entire wedding weekend unfolds in one beautiful place. Your ceremony, your reception, your closest family and friends staying overnight... all here, surrounded by mature trees, gardens, and the kind of peace that's hard to find these days.
What couples tell us they love most? Not having to coordinate transportation between venues, not worrying about where guests will stay, and having one experienced team handle everything from your first tour to your last dance.
Two Ceremony Spaces
The Spring Garden — outdoor beneath mature trees, overlooking our reflection pond.
The Conservatory — elegant indoor with crystal chandeliers and a marble fireplace.
Reception Venues
Spring View Ballroom — intimate and refined for 50-150 guests.
The Carriage House — dramatic and spacious for 150-250 guests.
One Simple, Transparent Price
Our per-person pricing includes everything — no hidden fees, no surprises:
Ceremony space • Reception venue • Plated dinner catering
Full premium open bar • All rentals (tables, linens, china, glassware)
Day-of coordination team • Guest accommodations on-site
No separate venue rental fee. Just one clear number.
I'd love to show you around in person. There's something about standing in the garden at golden hour, or seeing the ballroom lit by candlelight, that helps you picture your own wedding day unfolding here.
Ready for a tour?
Just reply to this email with a few dates and times that work for you.

Weekday or weekend, whatever fits your schedule. I'll bring the warm cookies and refreshments. You bring your questions and your vision.
Talk soon,
Lisa

001_e_day2_what_to_look_for.name: 001 E Day 2 - What to Look For
001_e_day2_what_to_look_for.subject: A few things I wish every couple knew before touring venues
001_e_day2_what_to_look_for.previewText: You're about to see a lot of beautiful spaces. Here's what to actually pay attention to...
001_e_day2_what_to_look_for.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, You're probably about to visit several venues over the next few weeks, and honestly? They're all going to look gorgeous in their listing photos and during your tours. That's the easy part — every venue has beautiful images. Here's what I encourage couples to focus on instead — the stuff that actually affects your wedding day experience and the months of planning leading up to it. #1: Trust Your Gut When You Walk In Photos only tell you so much. When you visit a venue in person, pay attention to: Can you actually see YOUR wedding happening here?
Not someone else's Pinterest-perfect wedding — yours. The flowers you choose, the people you love gathered around you, your dad giving his toast, your first dance. Does the space feel right for your guest count?
A venue that feels perfect for 100 guests might feel empty for 200, or cramped for 250. Ask to see the space set up for a guest count similar to yours. Do you feel welcomed, or like you're being sold to?
You'll be working with this team for a year or more. Do they seem genuinely excited about your vision, or just going through the motions? That last one matters more than you'd think. Your venue coordinator becomes part of your wedding planning team — you want someone you're excited to work with. #2: Get Crystal Clear on "All-Inclusive" Every venue defines "all-inclusive" differently, and this is exactly where hidden costs love to hide. When you're touring venues (including ours!), worth asking specifically: • What's included in your base price vs. what costs extra? • Are linens included, or do you rent them separately? • Is there a day-of coordinator included? • Will there be any surprise charges? (Service fees, admin fees, etc.) At Cameron Estate, our per-person price covers all of the above. No separate venue rental fee. No gotchas. One clear number. #3: Think About the Planning Process Your venue choice determines how you'll spend the next year of your life: Will you be coordinating with five different vendors?
When you book separate venues, caterers, rental companies, bar services, and coordinators, you become the project manager of your own wedding. Who's managing your timeline and setup?
Things go wrong at every wedding — it's how they're handled that matters. If something goes sideways, who fixes it?
The answer should be "we do" — not "that's between you and your vendors." When one experienced team manages everything in one location — as we do at Cameron Estate — planning gets significantly easier. And your wedding day runs significantly smoother. I'd love to show you around Cameron Estate and answer any questions you have about how we compare to other places you're visiting. We have warm cookies and refreshments ready for you! Just reply with a few dates that work for a tour, or email me anytime with questions. Talk soon,
Lisa
001_e_day2_what_to_look_for.compiledHtml:
You're about to see a lot of beautiful spaces. Here's what to actually pay attention to...
{{contact.first_name}},
You're probably about to visit several venues over the next few weeks, and honestly? They're all going to look gorgeous in their listing photos and during your tours. That's the easy part — every venue has beautiful images.
Here's what I encourage couples to focus on instead — the stuff that actually affects your wedding day experience and the months of planning leading up to it.
#1: Trust Your Gut When You Walk In
Photos only tell you so much. When you visit a venue in person, pay attention to:
Can you actually see YOUR wedding happening here?
Not someone else's Pinterest-perfect wedding — yours. The flowers you choose, the people you love gathered around you, your dad giving his toast, your first dance.
Does the space feel right for your guest count?
A venue that feels perfect for 100 guests might feel empty for 200, or cramped for 250. Ask to see the space set up for a guest count similar to yours.
Do you feel welcomed, or like you're being sold to?
You'll be working with this team for a year or more. Do they seem genuinely excited about your vision, or just going through the motions?
That last one matters more than you'd think. Your venue coordinator becomes part of your wedding planning team — you want someone you're excited to work with.
#2: Get Crystal Clear on "All-Inclusive"
Every venue defines "all-inclusive" differently, and this is exactly where hidden costs love to hide. When you're touring venues (including ours!), worth asking specifically:
• What's included in your base price vs. what costs extra?
• Are linens included, or do you rent them separately?
• Is there a day-of coordinator included?
• Will there be any surprise charges? (Service fees, admin fees, etc.)
At Cameron Estate, our per-person price covers all of the above. No separate venue rental fee. No gotchas. One clear number.
#3: Think About the Planning Process
Your venue choice determines how you'll spend the next year of your life:
Will you be coordinating with five different vendors?
When you book separate venues, caterers, rental companies, bar services, and coordinators, you become the project manager of your own wedding.
Who's managing your timeline and setup?
Things go wrong at every wedding — it's how they're handled that matters.
If something goes sideways, who fixes it?
The answer should be "we do" — not "that's between you and your vendors."
When one experienced team manages everything in one location — as we do at Cameron Estate — planning gets significantly easier. And your wedding day runs significantly smoother.
I'd love to show you around Cameron Estate and answer any questions you have about how we compare to other places you're visiting. We have warm cookies and refreshments ready for you!
Just reply with a few dates that work for a tour, or email me anytime with questions.
Talk soon,
Lisa

001_e_day3_stories.name: 001 E Day 3 - Stories
001_e_day3_stories.subject: "We knew within minutes"
001_e_day3_stories.previewText: Three couples share what made them choose Cameron Estate. Their stories might help you decide...
001_e_day3_stories.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, I wanted to share something with you that I think might help as you continue exploring venues. When couples tour Cameron Estate — people just like you — they often tell me something interesting: they knew within the first few minutes whether it was right for them. Not because we have the fanciest ballroom in Lancaster County, or the most acres, or the highest search ranking. They knew because they could genuinely picture their wedding happening here. They weren't looking at a wedding anymore — they were seeing their wedding. What Recent Couples Are Saying "We looked at five venues over two weekends. Cameron Estate was the only one where we could actually see our day unfolding. The all-inclusive approach meant we weren't stressed about coordinating vendors, arguing about chair rental fees, or hiring a day-of coordinator. We could just enjoy planning our wedding instead of managing a construction project." — Jennifer & Michael, October 2025 "Our families loved Cameron Estate as much as we did. Having everyone stay on-site for the weekend — gathering Friday night, celebrating all day Saturday, brunching together Sunday — made our wedding feel less like a stressful event and more like a celebration with the people we love most. Our parents still talk about how special that made the whole experience." — Rachel & David, June 2025 "The pricing was crystal clear from our first conversation with Lisa. No surprises, no hidden fees, no 'oh by the way this costs extra' showing up three months before the wedding. That peace of mind — knowing exactly what we were paying for and what it included — was worth absolutely everything. We could focus on the fun parts of planning instead of worrying about the budget." — Amanda & Chris, September 2024 I don't know if Cameron Estate is the right fit for your celebration — truly, only you can decide that. But if you're still exploring your options and haven't found that moment of clarity yet, I'd love to give you the same experience these couples had: a chance to walk the grounds, see the spaces, and envision your own wedding day here. Ready to see Cameron Estate in person? Just reply with a few dates that work for you, and I'll get you on the calendar. I'm here whenever you're ready. And honestly? I would genuinely love to hear your love story — how you met, what you're envisioning, what matters most to you about your wedding day. Talk soon,
Lisa

001_e_day5_vision.name: 001 E Day 5 - Vision
001_e_day5_vision.subject: {{contact.first_name}}, can you see it?
001_e_day5_vision.previewText: Close your eyes. Picture your wedding day. Where are you standing?
001_e_day5_vision.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, Here's a question worth sitting with for a minute — maybe with your coffee this morning, or as you're winding down this evening: When you picture your wedding day — really picture it, in vivid detail — where are you? Can you see yourself walking down an aisle surrounded by ancient trees, with golden sunlight filtering through the branches, your closest people seated on either side as you make your way toward the person you love? Can you hear the sound of your guests' laughter floating across the lawn during cocktail hour, the clink of glasses as people toast to your future, the murmur of conversation as everyone enjoys being together? Can you feel what it's like to step into your reception space, look around, and see everyone you love in one room — your families, your friends, the people who've shaped who you are as a couple — all gathered here to celebrate you? "That feeling — that moment of clarity when you can actually see your memories happening — that's what matters." The venue you choose should be the place where you can genuinely see your memories happening. Where you can imagine your dad's toast, your first dance, the moment you look around the room and think, 'We did this. This is ours.' Is That Cameron Estate for You? I don't know the answer to that question yet. But I'd love to give you the chance to find out. I've watched hundreds of couples tour Cameron Estate over the years, and here's what I've noticed: the ones who book with us — the couples who decide "yes, this is it" — they usually get quiet for a second during the tour. They're not looking at the chandeliers anymore. They're looking at each other. And you can see it click. They're not seeing a wedding anymore. They're seeing their wedding. Our calendar is filling up nicely for the upcoming seasons. Just reply with 2-3 dates that work for you, and I'll get you on the calendar. Warm cookies and good conversation await! Talk soon,
Lisa

001_e_day7_pinterest.name: 001 E Day 7 - Pinterest
001_e_day7_pinterest.subject: We made you a Pinterest board
001_e_day7_pinterest.previewText: Romantic garden party? Moody autumnal vibes? Black-tie elegance? Yes, yes, and yes...
001_e_day7_pinterest.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, Quick question for you: What does your dream wedding actually look like? When you think about your wedding day — not what you're "supposed to" want, but what you actually envision — what do you see? Soft and romantic with lots of candlelight, fresh flowers everywhere, an intimate gathering of your closest people? Bold and dramatic with rich, moody colors, a dramatic black-tie affair, making a statement with every detail? Classic elegance — timeless, sophisticated, the kind of wedding that could have been in any era and still looks perfect? A boho garden party — relaxed, organic, nature-inspired, completely you? Something totally unexpected that perfectly captures you two as a couple, whatever that looks like? Here's the Thing About Cameron Estate... We've hosted all of these weddings. And then some. The estate doesn't dictate your style — it adapts to it. The brick and the trees and the chandeliers provide a beautiful backdrop, but what you create here is completely yours. Cameron Estate is a canvas for your vision, not a template that everything has to fit into. That's Why We Created a Pinterest Board for You I put together a collection of real weddings from Cameron Estate — couples who trusted us with their day and created something beautiful. It shows just how versatile this space is: ✓ Romantic spring garden ceremonies under the trees
✓ Elegant candlelit receptions in the Spring View Ballroom
✓ Dramatic fall weddings with rich burgundy and gold
✓ Intimate winter celebrations by the fireplace
✓ Bold, modern designs that felt totally fresh and unexpected Browse Our Pinterest Board → Grab a coffee, open Pinterest, and spend a few minutes scrolling through. See what makes you say "oh, that's us." That's the fun part of wedding planning — discovering what really resonates with you. And if something catches your eye, or if you want to talk through how your vision would work here at Cameron Estate, just hit reply. I genuinely love these conversations — talking about wedding design and what makes a day feel special is literally my favorite thing. Talk soon,
Lisa

Romantic garden party? Moody autumnal vibes? Black-tie elegance? Yes, yes, and yes...
{{contact.first_name}},
Quick question for you: What does your dream wedding actually look like?

Soft and romantic with lots of candlelight, fresh flowers everywhere, an intimate gathering of your closest people?
Bold and dramatic with rich, moody colors, a dramatic black-tie affair, making a statement with every detail?
Classic elegance — timeless, sophisticated, the kind of wedding that could have been in any era and still looks perfect?
A boho garden party — relaxed, organic, nature-inspired, completely you?
Something totally unexpected that perfectly captures you two as a couple, whatever that looks like?
Here's the Thing About Cameron Estate...
We've hosted all of these weddings. And then some.
The estate doesn't dictate your style — it adapts to it. The brick and the trees and the chandeliers provide a beautiful backdrop, but what you create here is completely yours. Cameron Estate is a canvas for your vision, not a template that everything has to fit into.
That's Why We Created a Pinterest Board for You
I put together a collection of real weddings from Cameron Estate — couples who trusted us with their day and created something beautiful. It shows just how versatile this space is:
✓ Romantic spring garden ceremonies under the trees
✓ Elegant candlelit receptions in the Spring View Ballroom
✓ Dramatic fall weddings with rich burgundy and gold
✓ Intimate winter celebrations by the fireplace
✓ Bold, modern designs that felt totally fresh and unexpected
Browse Our Pinterest Board →
Grab a coffee, open Pinterest, and spend a few minutes scrolling through. See what makes you say "oh, that's us." That's the fun part of wedding planning — discovering what really resonates with you.
And if something catches your eye, or if you want to talk through how your vision would work here at Cameron Estate, just hit reply. I genuinely love these conversations — talking about wedding design and what makes a day feel special is literally my favorite thing.
Talk soon,

001_e_day10_inclusions.name: 001 E Day 10 - Inclusions
001_e_day10_inclusions.subject: What "all-inclusive" really means at Cameron Estate
001_e_day10_inclusions.previewText: Not all all-inclusive packages are created equal. Here is exactly what is included in ours — and what you handle elsewhere...
001_e_day10_inclusions.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, You're probably seeing "all-inclusive" at every venue you research right now. Venue websites, wedding planning blogs, Instagram ads — everyone's using that term. But here's what I've learned after years in this industry: "all-inclusive" means something completely different at every single venue. There's no standard definition. It's a marketing term that gets thrown around without any real meaning behind it. Let me show you exactly what it means at Cameron Estate. No marketing spin, no fine print hidden on page 12 of the contract — just a straightforward list of what's included when you book your wedding with us. What's Included: The Essentials Your Venue & Ceremony Spaces:
Your choice of ceremony location — Spring Garden or Conservatory — is included. Cocktail hour space. Your reception ballroom — Spring View Ballroom or Carriage House, depending on your guest count. No separate venue rental fee. No "facility charge." You pay one per-person price that includes the spaces. Event Essentials:
Tables and chairs for both ceremony and reception — included. Premium linens (tablecloths and napkins) in your choice of colors — included. Centerpiece vases and table decor elements — included. Cake cutting and service — included. Setup crew to transform the spaces according to your vision. Cleanup crew to handle everything after. Getting Ready Spaces:
Two private changing spaces provided for the couple to prepare before the ceremony. No need to book a hotel room just for getting ready — we have you covered right here on the estate. Food, Beverage & Staff Food & Beverage:
Full plated dinner service with our experienced culinary team. Champagne toast (included in select packages). Premium open bar featuring beer, wine, liquor, and all the mixers. Professional bartender services throughout your reception. All glassware, china, and flatware — nothing extra to rent, nothing to coordinate. Staffing & Coordination:
Your dedicated event coordinator who handles timeline planning, vendor coordination, and day-of management from contract signing to cake cutting. Professional wait staff for your plated dinner service. Bar staff throughout your reception. Setup and cleanup crew. What You Handle Separately (But We Have Great Recommendations!) • Flowers and floral design • Photography and videography • Music, DJ, or band • Wedding cake (from local bakeries) • Invitations and paper goods • Your dress, attire, rings "The difference this makes in your planning experience is hard to overstate." Instead of coordinating with a venue, caterer, rental company, bar service, day-of coordinator, and cleanup crew — you coordinate with one person at one place. Your planning becomes simpler. Your costs become clearer. Your wedding day becomes smoother. I encourage you to compare this to other venues you're considering. Ask them specifically: "What's included in your per-person price, and what costs extra?" The details matter. The answers will be very revealing. Want to see how this all comes together at Cameron Estate? Reply with a few dates for your tour, and I'll show you every space, explain every detail, and answer every question you have. Talk soon,
Lisa
001_e_day10_inclusions.compiledHtml:
Not all all-inclusive packages are created equal. Here is exactly what is included in ours — and what you handle elsewhere...
{{contact.first_name}},
You're probably seeing "all-inclusive" at every venue you research right now. Venue websites, wedding planning blogs, Instagram ads — everyone's using that term.
But here's what I've learned after years in this industry: "all-inclusive" means something completely different at every single venue. There's no standard definition. It's a marketing term that gets thrown around without any real meaning behind it.
Let me show you exactly what it means at Cameron Estate. No marketing spin, no fine print hidden on page 12 of the contract — just a straightforward list of what's included when you book your wedding with us.
What's Included: The Essentials
Your Venue & Ceremony Spaces:
Your choice of ceremony location — Spring Garden or Conservatory — is included. Cocktail hour space. Your reception ballroom — Spring View Ballroom or Carriage House, depending on your guest count. No separate venue rental fee. No "facility charge." You pay one per-person price that includes the spaces.
Event Essentials:
Tables and chairs for both ceremony and reception — included. Premium linens (tablecloths and napkins) in your choice of colors — included. Centerpiece vases and table decor elements — included. Cake cutting and service — included. Setup crew to transform the spaces according to your vision. Cleanup crew to handle everything after.
Getting Ready Spaces:
Two private changing spaces provided for the couple to prepare before the ceremony. No need to book a hotel room just for getting ready — we have you covered right here on the estate.
Food, Beverage & Staff
Food & Beverage:
Full plated dinner service with our experienced culinary team. Champagne toast (included in select packages). Premium open bar featuring beer, wine, liquor, and all the mixers. Professional bartender services throughout your reception. All glassware, china, and flatware — nothing extra to rent, nothing to coordinate.
Staffing & Coordination:
Your dedicated event coordinator who handles timeline planning, vendor coordination, and day-of management from contract signing to cake cutting. Professional wait staff for your plated dinner service. Bar staff throughout your reception. Setup and cleanup crew.
What You Handle Separately
(But We Have Great Recommendations!)
• Flowers and floral design
• Photography and videography
• Music, DJ, or band
• Wedding cake (from local bakeries)
• Invitations and paper goods
• Your dress, attire, rings
"The difference this makes in your planning experience is hard to overstate."
Instead of coordinating with a venue, caterer, rental company, bar service, day-of coordinator, and cleanup crew — you coordinate with one person at one place. Your planning becomes simpler. Your costs become clearer. Your wedding day becomes smoother.
I encourage you to compare this to other venues you're considering. Ask them specifically: "What's included in your per-person price, and what costs extra?" The details matter. The answers will be very revealing.
Want to see how this all comes together at Cameron Estate? Reply with a few dates for your tour, and I'll show you every space, explain every detail, and answer every question you have.
Talk soon,
Lisa

001_e_day12_faq.name: 001 E Day 12 - FAQ
001_e_day12_faq.subject: Questions couples ask at this stage
001_e_day12_faq.previewText: You're probably wondering about deposits, cancellations, and what-ifs. Let me answer those now...
001_e_day12_faq.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, Twelve days into your venue search, and you're probably asking yourself a lot of the same questions that every couple asks at this stage. Let me address what I hear most often — directly and honestly. "What if we find something better after we book?" You might. That's the nature of exploring — you never know what you might find around the next corner. But here's what I want you to consider: you've now seen Cameron Estate. You know what we offer, what our spaces look like, what's included in our pricing, and how we work with couples. You've developed clarity on what matters to you by seeing what's available. If another venue offers something significantly different — a feature you genuinely need that we don't have, a date we don't have available, a price point that works better for your budget — then you'll know. And you can make an informed decision. But that clarity only comes from seeing what's actually out there, which you're doing. "Is the pricing really final? Are there hidden fees?" Yes. Your proposal includes exactly what we discussed — the per-person price for your estimated guest count, covering all food, beverage, venue access, rentals, and coordination services. No surprises. No hidden fees. No add-ons that you didn't expect showing up three months before your wedding. If your guest count changes significantly, we'll adjust accordingly. But there are no secret "service fees," no "admin charges," no "setup costs" that appear later. The number we quote is the number you pay. "What if we need to cancel or postpone?" Life happens. People's circumstances change. Even the best-laid plans sometimes need to shift. We understand that, and our policies reflect that reality. Here's how our deposit and payment structure works: Initial deposit — This holds your date on our calendar. It's non-refundable, as is standard in the industry (because when we hold your date, we turn away other couples who might want it). Payment schedule — Your remaining balance is spread out over the course of your engagement, making it manageable rather than one large payment. Cancellation terms — Clear and fair, outlined in your contract. If you need to cancel, you won't be on the hook for the full amount. If you need to postpone to a future date, we work with you to find a new date that works. I'm happy to walk through the specific terms with you — just ask. Transparency is important to us. "How do we actually know it's the right choice?" Honestly? You won't know completely until your wedding day. That's the honest truth about planning a celebration this important — you're making decisions years in advance about something you can't fully experience until it happens. But here's what couples tell us: they felt relief, not anxiety, when they made their decision. They felt ready to stop searching and start planning. They could picture their day here, and that picture felt right. If you're feeling anxious or uncertain, keep exploring. If you're feeling relief and excitement when you think about Cameron Estate, that's worth paying attention to. "What happens next if we book?" Here's what the rest of your wedding planning journey looks like with Cameron Estate: Step 1: You select your date and secure it with your deposit. The date is officially yours. Step 2: We schedule a comprehensive planning meeting — either in person or virtual, whatever works for you — to discuss your vision in detail. Colors, flowers, menu preferences, timeline, all of it. Step 3: You receive your dedicated coordinator — the person who will guide you through every step of the planning process, answer your questions, help you make decisions, and manage all the details. Step 4: We handle all vendor coordination. Your coordinator works with your florist, photographer, DJ, and any other vendors to make sure everyone is on the same page. Step 5: We manage timeline planning, setup, and day-of execution. You show up on your wedding day, and we handle everything. That's the beauty of having one team manage everything: you get to actually enjoy your wedding day instead of managing it. Questions I Didn't Anticipate? Let's talk. I'm here to answer anything I haven't covered. Or reach out however works best for you: Email: ceiweddings@cameronestateinn.com
Phone: 717-725-4831 Take your time. Good decisions aren't rushed — but our calendar is real, and availability does shift as couples make decisions. If you've been thinking about Cameron Estate, I hope you'll give us the chance to show you around.
001_e_day12_faq.compiledHtml:
You're probably wondering about deposits, cancellations, and what-ifs. Let me answer those now...
{{contact.first_name}},
Twelve days into your venue search, and you're probably asking yourself a lot of the same questions that every couple asks at this stage. Let me address what I hear most often — directly and honestly.
"What if we find something better after we book?"
You might. That's the nature of exploring — you never know what you might find around the next corner.
But here's what I want you to consider: you've now seen Cameron Estate. You know what we offer, what our spaces look like, what's included in our pricing, and how we work with couples. You've developed clarity on what matters to you by seeing what's available.
If another venue offers something significantly different — a feature you genuinely need that we don't have, a date we don't have available, a price point that works better for your budget — then you'll know. And you can make an informed decision. But that clarity only comes from seeing what's actually out there, which you're doing.
"Is the pricing really final? Are there hidden fees?"
Yes. Your proposal includes exactly what we discussed — the per-person price for your estimated guest count, covering all food, beverage, venue access, rentals, and coordination services. No surprises. No hidden fees. No add-ons that you didn't expect showing up three months before your wedding.
If your guest count changes significantly, we'll adjust accordingly. But there are no secret "service fees," no "admin charges," no "setup costs" that appear later. The number we quote is the number you pay.
"What if we need to cancel or postpone?"
Life happens. People's circumstances change. Even the best-laid plans sometimes need to shift. We understand that, and our policies reflect that reality.
Here's how our deposit and payment structure works:
Initial deposit — This holds your date on our calendar. It's non-refundable, as is standard in the industry (because when we hold your date, we turn away other couples who might want it).
Payment schedule — Your remaining balance is spread out over the course of your engagement, making it manageable rather than one large payment.
Cancellation terms — Clear and fair, outlined in your contract. If you need to cancel, you won't be on the hook for the full amount. If you need to postpone to a future date, we work with you to find a new date that works.
I'm happy to walk through the specific terms with you — just ask. Transparency is important to us.
"How do we actually know it's the right choice?"
Honestly? You won't know completely until your wedding day. That's the honest truth about planning a celebration this important — you're making decisions years in advance about something you can't fully experience until it happens.
But here's what couples tell us: they felt relief, not anxiety, when they made their decision. They felt ready to stop searching and start planning. They could picture their day here, and that picture felt right.
If you're feeling anxious or uncertain, keep exploring. If you're feeling relief and excitement when you think about Cameron Estate, that's worth paying attention to.
"What happens next if we book?"
Here's what the rest of your wedding planning journey looks like with Cameron Estate:
Step 1: You select your date and secure it with your deposit. The date is officially yours.
Step 2: We schedule a comprehensive planning meeting — either in person or virtual, whatever works for you — to discuss your vision in detail. Colors, flowers, menu preferences, timeline, all of it.
Step 3: You receive your dedicated coordinator — the person who will guide you through every step of the planning process, answer your questions, help you make decisions, and manage all the details.
Step 4: We handle all vendor coordination. Your coordinator works with your florist, photographer, DJ, and any other vendors to make sure everyone is on the same page.
Step 5: We manage timeline planning, setup, and day-of execution. You show up on your wedding day, and we handle everything.
That's the beauty of having one team manage everything: you get to actually enjoy your wedding day instead of managing it.
Questions I Didn't Anticipate?
Let's talk. I'm here to answer anything I haven't covered.
Or reach out however works best for you:
Email: ceiweddings@cameronestateinn.com
Phone: 717-725-4831
Take your time. Good decisions aren't rushed — but our calendar is real, and availability does shift as couples make decisions. If you've been thinking about Cameron Estate, I hope you'll give us the chance to show you around.

001_e_day14_close.name: 001 E Day 14 - Close
001_e_day14_close.subject: Wishing you the best, {{contact.first_name}}
001_e_day14_close.previewText: I haven't heard from you, which tells me you've likely found your venue. Congratulations, and best wishes...
001_e_day14_close.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, I haven't heard from you in a bit, so I'm assuming you've likely found your wedding venue or decided to go in a different direction. I just wanted to send one last note to say: congratulations. Planning a wedding is a big journey. Wherever you've chosen to celebrate, I truly hope it's everything you've envisioned. I hope the day is full of joy, that the weather is perfect, and that you're surrounded by people who love you. If you are still looking and just haven't had a chance to reply — life gets busy! — I'm still here. You can always reach back out to me, even months from now. If we have the date available, we'd love to host you. But for now, I'll take you off my follow-up list so I'm not clogging your inbox. All the best,
Lisa
001_e_day14_close.compiledHtml:

If you are still looking and just haven't had a chance to reply — life gets busy! — I'm still here. You can always reach back out to me, even months from now. If we have the date available, we'd love to host you.

All the best,

sms.name: 001 T Day 1 - Intro SMS
sms.content: {{contact.first_name}}, Hi! This is Lisa from Cameron Estate Inn. I just sent over our wedding information and pricing—everything should be in your inbox now. If texting is easier for questions, I'm happy to answer here. Congratulations again on your engagement! - Lisa

sms.name: 001 T Day 2 - Morning Text
sms.content: Hi {{contact.first_name}}, what questions can I answer about Cameron Estate? Most couples want to know about pricing, availability, or what's included in our all-inclusive packages. I'm here to help! - Lisa

sms.name: 001 T Day 3 - Evening Text
sms.content:
{{contact.first_name}}, I thought you might need some wedding inspo! I curated a Pinterest board with some of our favorite wedding inspiration at Cameron Estate. Hope this helps spark some ideas for your big day! - Lisa
{{trigger_link.kI4aVPLShqovAveOSkbk}}

sms.name: 001 T Day 4 - Text
sms.content: Hi {{contact.first_name}}, what would make touring Cameron Estate easier for you? Weekend availability? Evening tours? Virtual walkthrough first? I’ll drop the link to book your perfect time below. Let me know how I can help. - Lisa https://calendly.com/cameron-estate/tour

sms.name: 001 T Day 9 - Pinterest Check-in
sms.content: {{contact.first_name}}, have you had a chance to check out our Pinterest board yet? {{trigger_link.kI4aVPLShqovAveOSkbk}} would love to hear more about your color palette! - Lisa

sms.name: 001 T Day 12 - Final SMS
sms.content: {{contact.first_name}}, this is my last note. If you'd like to see Cameron Estate, I'm here anytime. If you've chosen another direction, I wish you the very best. Congratulations on your wedding! - Lisa
